chunks.en: Lost 200k in US stocks last Friday, what to do?
US stocks plummeted last Friday. I previously bought small-cap stocks with all my funds, planning to hold them for a while.

Unexpectedly, small-cap stocks crashed for three or four days. I kept enduring it, but didn't expect the crash on Friday. I was afraid the market would continue to plummet, so I cut my losses, and lost a lot of money.
I want to ask everyone, losing money in trading always affects my mentality. I'm starting to feel like I'm not suitable for trading ğŸ˜”?
What should I do?
How are the words 'all in', 'small-cap stocks', and 'hold for a long time' used together?
If you're not suitable, then don't do it. Buying some index funds and ignoring them might be more effective.
@csys Aren't there many people on X recommending small-cap stocks, like hims and others?
Have you been spending too much time on V2EX? Every thread discussing finance is just about blindly buying US stocks.
I also cut my losses on small-cap stocks.
Don't look at it, check again at the end of the year.
Admit the loss.
Yes, you are not suitable for trading. If 200k is just the value in RMB, that further proves it.
The loss is exactly 1/100th of yours... I haven't cut my losses and plan to buy more.
Gambler's way of stock trading.
Hold on.
You have to be able to accept how much you can lose to earn how much you want, so I haven't tried financial plans that may lose a lot afterwards.
Always affects mentality, feeling that you are not suitable for trading ğŸ˜”? --- Everyone (ordinary people) is like this.
I suggest you think carefully about how to operate, listening to other people's advice is likely to regret it later.
@ulala Indexes also fall. You can't judge whether it's a bear market or a bull market right now.
After going up, there are too many uncertainties and inflation is rising again.
@565656 What if it drops to zero by the end of the year?
Like Intel, which kept falling from 2022 to 2024.
@dji38838c Yes, I think so too, 200k RMB.
@NoirStrike There is 50%.
@Donahue I can't accept it, losing money makes me feel bad and easily leads to a breakdown.
Holding long-term is the same for ordinary people, they can't hold.

I used to buy penny stocks, small-cap stocks, and Chinese concept stocks, losing a lot of money. I put in over 100k , I'm afraid there's not much left now, some stocks have even been delisted, I'm just pretending to be dead.
@ulala Trading in 2025 feels much harder than in 2024 and 2023, with more uncertainties.
US stocks fluctuate greatly.
